page.title: 13ETHNIC MATTERS IN DUDLEY (2)
page.content: To Muslim families in particular integration is difficult. The girls should remain veiled, and only have contact with members of the immediate family. Their limbs must remain covered, even during physical education lessons, which does not enable them to participate in swimming lessons. Hindus, Sikhs and Muslims must take care not to eat any forbidden{ {foods.}This requires school kitchens to have alternatives available. Some Asian dishes are incorporated into cookery lessons in schools. Fasting takes place at special times as do various festivals that occur throughout the year. Each family decides how much or how little they become involved in the 'British' way of life.
